benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from invoice item

covered: DELETE/Valid Deletion: Multiple success paths verified (remove all when query param omitted, remove subset, one/no custom fields, duplicates tolerated, large lists), all expecting 204 and empty body.
DELETE/Non-Existent Resource: 400 for invalid invoiceItemId format and 404 for valid-but-missing invoice item.

Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (present/missing), optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted; robustness for header casing/whitespace; long comment boundary (positive case).
Query Parameters: Validation of malformed customField IDs, handling duplicates, presence vs absence semantics, extra/unexpected params, injection attempt handling.
Authorization/Errors: 401 for invalid/expired token; service unavailability handled (503).
Resilience: Heavy load scenario validating acceptable response time with 204.
gaps: DELETE/Concurrency: No scenarios for simultaneous deletes on the same invoice item or fields (race conditions, time-of-check/time-of-use).
DELETE/Soft delete behavior: No explicit verification whether deletes are hard vs soft (e.g., follow-up GET confirms absence; audit/history behavior).
Response headers: No checks for headers on 204 (e.g., Content-Type consistency with "Produces: application/json") or content-negotiation behavior.
Association validation: Behavior when passing valid UUIDs that are not associated to the target invoice item (ignored vs error) is not tested.
Query param encoding: No scenario to assert collectionFormat=multi strictly (e.g., CSV list rejected); no test for empty value customField= resulting in 400.
Required header value validation: Empty/whitespace or overlong X-Killbill-CreatedBy not tested; overlong X-Killbill-Comment negative case (expecting 400/413) missing.
Unexpected body handling: No test sending a request body to ensure it is ignored or rejected (400/415).
Authorization granularity: 403 (authenticated but not authorized) not covered.
Idempotency across calls: No explicit repeat-delete scenario to confirm repeated DELETEs remain 204 and state stable.
Error response schema: Tests assert presence of error message but do not validate standardized error payload structure (fields like code, message, kb-specific details).
recommendations: Add concurrency tests: two clients delete the same custom field at the same time; verify one succeeds and the other remains idempotent (204) or returns the agreed error without corrupting state.
Verify post-state via GET: after delete, GET the invoice item custom fields to confirm absence; if soft-delete exists, validate audit/history endpoints show deletion metadata.
Validate response headers and 204 semantics: assert no body on 204; clarify/verify Content-Type behavior given "Produces: application/json".
Test association validation: provide valid UUIDs not linked to the invoice item; define and assert expected behavior (ignore vs 404/400).
Assert collectionFormat=multi strictly: test customField as CSV (comma-separated) should be rejected or documented as supported; test customField with empty value (customField=) returns 400.
Extend header validation: empty/whitespace-only X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400; overlong CreatedBy/Comment -> 400/413; also verify Reason/comment persistence if auditable.
Add unexpected body test: send a JSON body and assert it is ignored or rejected per API contract.
Cover 403 Forbidden: authenticated user without permission should receive 403.
Add idempotency test across calls: issue the same DELETE twice (same IDs); both should return 204 and leave state consistent.
Validate error schema: assert standard error fields (e.g., type/code, message, requestId) for 400/401/404/503 responses.
